content: So, # (ball x r) = # (ball y r) ? aren't the last two bullets then trivial? or is it not so because you have to convert "finite -> finite cardinal -> finite" ?
( “trivial” is probably a dangerous word to use around here :) )
I would rather show that an isometric equivalence α ≃iso β restricts to an isometric equivalence ball x r ≃iso ball y r. Everything else comes from this.
Rémi Bottinelli has marked this topic as resolved.
